  • Uses of ChannelData in org.torrent.nio

    Fields in org.torrent.nio with type parameters of type ChannelData 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.HashSet<ChannelData> NIOThread.timeoutStore
    When a connection is waiting for a message it is referenced here.
    Methods in org.torrent.nio with parameters of type ChannelData 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private java.nio.channels.SelectionKey NIOThread.assignReadWithTimeout​(java.nio.channels.Selector selector, java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel, ChannelData channelData, int timeout)
    When a channel is waiting to read a message, it will be registered with timeoutStore, where it will be periodically polled.
    private void NIOThread.closeConnection​(ChannelData channelData, TorrentFile tf, java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
    When a channel needs closing for any reason, this is where it is done.
    private java.util.ArrayDeque<byte[]> NIOThread.extractMessages​(ChannelData channelData, byte[] message)
    This message takes the message bytes received, combines them with any stored bytes in channelData's TCP store and breaks the resultant bytes down into individual messages, adding each messageW to the ArrayDeque before returning it
    private int NIOThread.processData​(ChannelData channelData)
    This method determines the next action a connection needs to take by processing various data and returning a key to register with the selector.
    private java.lang.String NIOThread.receiveMessage​(ChannelData channelData, java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel)
    This will process message data received, edit channelData's state if needed and then return a String message
    private void NIOThread.writeData​(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel, ChannelData channelData)
    Used for all write operations.
